text: ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/TP.jpg?v=1752745472&width=3840) ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/Rasam1.jpg?v=1752745835&width=3840) ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/mango.jpg?v=1752746061&width=3840) ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/Onion_Gojju_copy.jpg?v=1753092728&width=3840) ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/RHH_copy.jpg?v=1753335462&width=3840) ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/Bitter_copy.jpg?v=1753094270&width=3840) ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/TP_Mobile.jpg?v=1753331282&width=3840) ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/Rasam1_Mobile_7a5cb6dc-8b9c-4211-b501-2baad6bc7817.jpg?v=1753331171&width=3840) ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/Onion_Gojju_Mobile.jpg?v=1753331428&width=3840) ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/Ragi_Mobile.jpg?v=1753331540&width=3840) “Innovation is our strength, but heart is our foundation. Every product we create tells a story of care—crafted with love, driven by quality, and inspired by the desire to bring comfort, meaning, and a touch of joy to your everyday life.” ## Innovation At Indira Foods, innovation is more than just technology—it’s a mindset. ## Made with care Every Indira Foods product is crafted with attention, love, and a deep respect for tradition. ## Quality Quality is the heart of everything we do. We ensure every pack meets the highest standards of safety, consistency, and flavour. ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/Indira_Madam1.jpg?height=1452&v=1753084832) About Us Indira Foods began in a humble garage with a simple vision: to bring high-quality, traditional flavors to every kitchen. What started as a small venture quickly grew as our products gained local love, leading to the launch of our first factory in 1996. From our early offerings like ketchup, jam, and pickles, every product has reflected our commitment to quality. In 2002, we introduced **Ragi Huri Hittu** , now a beloved staple in many households. Today, Indira Foods serves both domestic and international markets, including bulk sales, institutional partnerships, and a growing retail presence. Our journey has always been guided by innovation, authenticity, and a deep understanding of our customers’ needs. At the heart of Indira is our Chairman, whose empathetic leadership has shaped our mission: to offer healthier, convenient choices that bring **"Poorna Santrupti"** – complete satisfaction. We remain committed to integrity, quality, and social responsibility—values that continue to drive every product we make. ## Our Story \----------- Founded by **Indira** , a woman with a deep love for traditional flavours, we earned early trust through homegrown recipes and a commitment to quality. From those humble beginnings, we’ve become a global player in food processing—serving customers across India and worldwide. ## Meet Our Directors Behind every great product at Indira Food is a team of passionate leaders who believe in doing things the right way — with honesty, care, and commitment. Our directors combine deep industry knowledge with a shared vision of delivering nutritious, safe, and delicious food to every household. Their leadership inspires our entire team to keep raising the bar every day. ![Vijay C Gowda](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/4A.jpg?v=1762922890&width=600) ### Vijay C Gowda Director - New product development & Innovations ![Uthaya A S](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/3A.jpg?v=1762922936&width=600) ### Uthaya A S Director - Manufacturing & Factory Management ![Sudhin Sharma](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/1A.jpg?v=1762923011&width=600) ### Sudhin Sharma Director - Bulk & Horeca: Sales & Marketing ![Ramesh N Gowda](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/2A.jpg?v=1762922981&width=600) ### Ramesh N Gowda Director - Exports & Finance ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/Indira_Madam.jpg?height=1452&v=1752828373) Our Founder **Indira** , our founder and Chairman, started small but dreamed big. text: ##### Made entirely from popped ragi (finger millet), this ready-to-eat mix is rich in calcium, protein, and dietary fibre. It’s gluten-free, sugar-free, and contains no preservatives—making it an ideal choice for adults, seniors, and diabetics. ###### **No cooking required** —just mix with milk or buttermilk for a nourishing meal or snack. Easy & Tasty Recipes _1\. Ladoo_ ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/preview_images/1498208f335e42e48dabd4b57531d0f3.thumbnail.0000000000.jpg?v=1752900455&width=1946) Play video ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/preview_images/1498208f335e42e48dabd4b57531d0f3.thumbnail.0000000000_2500x.jpg?v=1752900455) ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/Ragi_25b3dbed-f554-4be6-890f-a57e059fd734.jpg?v=1752747236&width=3840) ## “Ragi Huri Hittu Kids and Teens Special” ## _Wholesome Taste, Natural Nutrition_ Indira’s Ragi Huri Hittu Special is a 100% natural, ready-to-eat health mix made from popped ragi (finger millet), enriched with tasty malt, crunchy cashew nuts, and mild, aromatic spices. **No cooking required** —just mix with milk for ragi malt, porridge, laddus, or even energy bars. ### Frequently asked questions What is Ragi Huri Hittu? Ragi huri hittu is a traditional South Indian flour made from finger millet (ragi) that is carefully roasted (Popped) and then finely ground. The roasting process enhances its flavor, shelf life, and digestibility, giving it a mild, nutty taste. How to use Ragi Huri Hittu? Ragi huri hittu is typically used as an instant food that requires minimal or no cooking. It is mixed with warm water, milk, or buttermilk to make a smooth porridge or malt, which can be prepared either sweet (with jaggery or sugar and a pinch of cardamom) or savory (with salt, spices, and sometimes onion or green chili). It can also be blended with curd or coconut milk for a light meal or drink. Because it is roasted, it is easy to digest and is commonly consumed as a quick breakfast, evening meal, or nourishing drink for children and adults. When to have Ragi Huri Hittu? **Ragi Huri Hittu can be consumed at various times, depending on your dietary needs and preferences.** **1\. Breakfast:** Start your day with a nutritious ragi porridge (Ragi Ambli) made with Ragi Huri Hittu, milk and sugar. **2\. Mid-morning snack** : Mix Ragi Huri Hittu with milk or yogurt and enjoy as a healthy snack. **3\. Lunch:** Use Ragi Huri Hittu to make rotis or dosas, which can be paired with vegetables or lentils. **4\. Evening :** Ragi Huri Hittu with hot milk or Buttermilk or ragi Huri Hittu milkshake **5\. Before bed:** Consume a warm ragi porridge (Ragi Ambli) or ragi milkshake before bed for a relaxing and filling snack. What are the Nutrition benefits? Ragi huri hittu is highly nutritious and valued for its natural health benefits. It is an excellent source of **calcium** , which supports strong bones and teeth, and provides **iron** that helps maintain healthy hemoglobin levels. Rich in **dietary fiber** , it aids digestion, promotes a feeling of fullness, and supports healthy blood sugar management. Being **naturally gluten-free** , it is suitable for people with gluten intolerance. It also contains essential minerals and antioxidants, making it a wholesome, easily digestible food suitable for all age groups. Where to buy Indira's Ragi Huri Hittu?

text: * Add the onions and garlic and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes. Add the capsicum and sauté on a medium flame for another 1 to 2 minutes. * Add the tomato paste and salt, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 4 to 5 minutes, while stirring occasionally. * Remove the bayleaves and discard them. Add the tomato ketchup, oregano, chilli flakes and sugar, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 minute. * Add the cream, mix well and cook on a medium flame for another 1 to 2 minutes, while stirring continuously. * Add the fusilli, toss gently and cook on a medium flame for 2 more minutes, while stirring continuously. * Garnish with fresh cream and cheese and serve immediately with garlic bread. What is Tomato Paste? **Tomato paste** is a **thick, concentrated form of cooked tomatoes**. It’s made by simmering tomatoes for a long time until most of the water evaporates. The mixture is then strained to remove seeds and skin, and cooked again to form a **rich, smooth, intensely flavored paste**. Why Use Indira's Tomato Paste in Cooking? * Acts as a natural **souring agent** * **One tablespoon** of tomato paste equals **3-4 medium tomatoes** * **100% natural** with no added preservatives—use freely * Adds **volume** to dishes like curries, soups, rasams, and more * Provides a **richer, deeper flavor** and naturally enhances color * Because it’s concentrated, you get **more tomatoes in every spoonful** * Ensures a **uniform and consistent taste** every time * **Handy, quick, clean, and cost-effective** to use in daily cooking What are the advantages of using tomato paste? * **Intense Flavor** – Provides a deep, rich tomato taste instantly. * **Thickens Dishes** – Adds body to curries, soups, gravies, and sauces. * **Enhances Color** – Gives food a natural, vibrant red color. * **Saves Time** – No need to chop, cook, or reduce fresh tomatoes. * **Consistent Results** – Same taste and texture every time. * **More Tomatoes in Less Quantity** – Highly concentrated, so a little goes a long way. * **Convenient & Clean** – Ready to use straight from the pack, with no waste. * **Shelf-Stable** – Lasts longer than fresh tomatoes. * **Cost-Effective** – Replaces multiple tomatoes with a single spoon of paste. * **Versatile** – Works in Indian, Continental, Asian, Middle Eastern, and fusion recipes. * **Balances Flavors** – Adds natural sourness, umami, and richness. * **No Preservatives** Pure tomato goodness. When to use Tomato Paste? * For gravy-based curries * When fresh tomatoes are unavailable or not flavorful * To enhance color and richness in dishes * To speed up cooking (no long reduction needed) * To add balanced sourness and umami * For marinades (paneer/chicken tikkas) * In snacks, chaats, and fusion dishes * In rice dishes like tomato rice * To give consistency and volume to dal, rasam, or sabzis * For uniform taste in everyday cooking Where to buy Indira’s Tomato Paste?

Indira’s is known for delivering **consistent quality, rich taste, and trusted purity** , making it the preferred choice for customers seeking reliable flavor in every dish. With its concentrated strength and natural taste, it offers excellent value and versatility for all culinary needs. ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/MESS_copy.jpg?height=800&v=1765860843) Key Features and Benefits Tamarind Concentrate is valued as a versatile kitchen essential for its **Key Features and Benefits** , primarily offering **instant convenience** by eliminating the need to soak and strain raw tamarind, while ensuring a **consistent, potent flavor** in every use. This highly-concentrated, typically 100% natural paste also boasts a **long shelf life** and is both **space-saving and economical**. ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/Lemon_sized_copy.jpg?height=800&v=1765861792) About ½ teaspoon of tamarind concentrate equals the pulp of one lemon-sized tamarind fruit. ![](//www.indirafoods.in/cdn/shop/files/boil_copy.jpg?height=800&v=1765861395) Culinary Usage In terms of **Culinary Usage** , its balanced sourness is indispensable globally, forming the base of **South Indian** dishes like Sambar and Rasam, providing the signature tang for **North Indian** Imli Chutneys, and serving as a key ingredient in **Southeast Asian** favorites like Pad Thai, making it perfect for enhancing the complexity of curries, sauces, marinades, and even refreshing beverages. What is Tamarind Concentrate? Tamarind concentrate is a thick paste made from ripe tamarind pulp. It delivers a balanced sour-sweet flavor and is used as a convenient alternative to fresh tamarind. How do I use tamarind concentrate in cooking? Simply dilute it with water or add directly to dishes. It works well in curries, soups, chutneys, sauces, marinades, beverages, and desserts. How much tamarind concentrate equals fresh tamarind? Approximately ½ teaspoon of tamarind concentrate equals the pulp of one lemon-sized tamarind fruit. Is tamarind concentrate ready to use? Yes, it is fully processed and ready to use, saving time compared to soaking and extracting pulp from whole tamarind. Does tamarind concentrate need refrigeration? No, no need for refrigeration. What cuisines commonly use tamarind concentrate? Tamarind concentrate is widely used in Indian, Asian, Middle Eastern, and Latin American cuisines. Is tamarind concentrate suitable for vegetarian or vegan diets? Yes, it is plant-based and suitable for vegetarian and vegan cooking. How long does tamarind concentrate last? When stored properly, it has a long shelf life. Always check the best-before date on the packaging.
